text: Guys, in today's video we are going to talk about the box model in CSS. In any element, there is a content which is itself, then margin, then border and padding. This border, margin and padding are the concept of box model in CSS. In this video, we will understand all these things and see how margin, border, padding are set in CSS. So let's go to the computer screen. I am really very excited. Let's roll the intro. So guys, I have come inside my computer screen. And the first thing I will do here is show you this playlist. And you guys don't even click on the star here and don't even click here to access. You guys won't do that either. Do it, man. Click on the star here and click here to access. And I have also put the source code for you guys. Access it too. I want you to enjoy it too. Okay, so what do you guys do while enjoying it? The way I have made this folder here, what will I do by right-clicking shift? I will open it with code. As you can see, and this will open in my VS code. If your open with code option is not coming, which many people tell me that our open with code option is not coming. So I have a suggestion for you guys. What do you do? To install VS code again, run its setup again and see what options I have checked. Now I will come in the video and here I will make a file by making an index.html file and keep a boilerplate template. Here I will write CSS box model. After writing the CSS box model, I will make a style tag here. With the help of which I will make you guys. Oops, how did I make a style tag? Is it too fast? Guys, no, it's not fast. Okay, it will work. So what will I do while making a style tag here? I will put styles here and tell you how the box model works in CSS. So first of all, let's understand the concept of box model in CSS. What is the concept of box model in CSS? Look, everything in CSS is a box. Whatever elements we have made with HTML, they are all a box. Whether we make a container, whether we make a div, whether we make a span, they are all a box in our CSS. And there are some things in that box that I want to show you guys. So if you can see on the computer screen, you will see that here I have explained the concept of CSS box model. CSS box model means that padding is outside your content, this border is outside it, and this margin is outside it. So you should know this concept. One more thing I want to tell you guys is that, let's say I made a div.box here. I will write I am a box here. And if I show you the preview of this, this box has been created by saying I am a box. There is already some margin and padding outside this box, which you will know when I put a background on it. So what I will do is I will write dot box here, which means I selected the class selector box, and I will say background color is let us say aqua. So the background color of this box will be aqua. We can do the format document by doing it rightly, so that we will get good formatting. Now you see here there is some margin padding already in it. What I will do is using a universal selector, it happens that our browser plays a little smartly on its own. It says that this developer does not have a brain, so I will put some of my brain. And it adds margin padding by putting its own brain. It adds many more styles. And that's why we sometimes need to reset CSS. So I wrote m-0 here by putting a star. Sorry, I wrote m-0, so margin became 0. I wrote p-0, so padding became 0. These were emmet shortcuts. And what will happen by doing this, it will stick to the top, like spacing was coming here, it is not coming now. So I wrote I am a box, so let's do one thing, let's write I am a box. And here I wrote div.box, and here I can add multiple classes, by doing box1, box2. So I made a box, and made a box1. And I made a box, and made a box2.
